active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains ensures full blinding for party 1.
- Blinded statechains rely on trusting the server's report of partial signatures generated for a key.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation to achieve the final signature.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is limited but affordable with a potential growth of 210.24GB per year.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can provide storage for 21 years.
- Ongoing optimization efforts reduce space required by individual nodes, ensuring sufficient storage.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes implementing OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV) and introducing additional parameters.
- The new opcode enables the full generality of MATT with just two opcodes.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses the issue of channel backups and the inability to resume channel operations.
- The proposal introduces a new type of channel funding transaction with additional spending options.
